news1: The IT company’s net profit rose 18.7% year-on-year to ₹4,096 crore in the December quarter. The revenue also increased by 19.6% to ₹26,700 crore. The attrition rate, which is the percentage of the employees that leave, dropped sequentially to 21.7% from 23.8% in the September quarter. :
news2: In November, India’s factory output, which is measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP) rose 7.1%, according to government data. In comparison, IIP had contracted by 4% in October. Electricity sector (12.7%) recorded the highest growth, followed by mining (9.7%) and manufacturing (6.1%). :
news3: The retail inflation rate in the US declined to 6.5% in December from 7.1% in November. It has declined for the sixth consecutive month. However, the retail inflation rate still remains above the US Fed’s target of 2%. : Global markets (at 9:00 AM today)
